item.title: Tui reduces resident sentence for fatal crime in Zhuhai
item.description: The last court (TUI) decided to reduce the penalty of a 44 -year -old resident in August 2023 for killing another resident in Zhuhai. It all happened on a night of night fun that ended the worst way, in the Gongbei area, and the two men began to argue on the street when the murderer decided to attack the other resident with two scissors blows. The Base Judicial Court (TJB) sentenced the resident to an effective 15 -year prison for the practice, in material authorship and in a consummate form, of a crime of homicide. In addition, the resident was ordered to pay compensation of more than two million patacas to the widow, with interest. It was then that the murderer decided to appeal to the court of second instance, because he did not agree with the sentence, and Tui has now reduced this sentence to 13 years and nine months. Unintentionally “direct” According to the TUI judgment, the murderer requested the reduction of the sentence claiming that it was under the influence of alcohol and did not know that scissors could effectively kill the other resident. In addition, the applicant claimed that the police had been called before assaulting the man with the scissors. However, Tui understands that "such circumstances are not valid and effective to exclude their guilt as to conduct and its responsibility." Tui understands that a situation of "eventual deceit" is at stake and not a "direct" intention of killing the other, so it was possible to be possible "a moderate reduction in the penalty". The details of the case are described in the ruling: the two men were, around 12:02 am on July 31, 2023 eating with the deceased's wife and seven friends, and the murderer drank “three to four beer bottles”, some of them gone to play Mahjong to follow. The discussion between the two men took place around 3:50 am "for trivial reasons", becoming "increasingly serious." Friends tried to separate them unsuccessfully. Around four in the morning, the murderer “abandoned Mahjong's establishment, running, took a scissors from a fruit store with which he gave several blows to the left side of his left -handed chest, arm and forearm and thumb of the left hand” of the deceased. The death was declared at 4:15 am by the Zhuhai Public Security Police. The perpetrator was arrested at the entrance of Macau.

item.title: Takeaway | Up to 50% tariffs threaten restoration
item.description:
Home food delivery applications touched the restoration sector to the wall, imposing high delivery rates and changing customer habits. The Macao Catering Industry Association says APPs threaten business survival and calls for government intervention
When the COVID-19 pandemic forced social isolation and distancing, the mere act of taking a meal away from home became a nightmare. From this time, it became common to see the Macao roads full of MFood and Aomi scooters, and later to Tikbee. Finding the restrictions on combating pandemic, remained the habit of asking for meals, drinks and desserts through these platforms, and complaints from the restoration sector began to emerge. The president of the Macao Catering Industry Association, Aeson Law, has been one of the critical voices of how applications have changed the industry and forced restaurants to pay high delivery fees or abdicate a popular way to do business. "When there were no Takeaway platforms, if we faced 100 patacas, this value entered the box. Nowadays we even delivered 50 of these 100 patacas to applications, as well as the operating costs of a restaurant. It is difficult to survive in this scenario," said the representative, quoted by the citizen newspaper. The associative leader recalls that meal delivery platforms began by charging more than 20 percent of the amount charged to the customer as a distribution tariff, which considered reasonable. However, "apps also started charging distribution or delivery tariff to customers," he said, raising prices. As such, they ended up “asking traders to pay the slice that should be paid by the consumer,” he said. Do something Aeson Law does not realize why applications have been charging twice distribution rates. The fact is that restaurants are required to pay twice if they want to occupy a summit place in the ranking of applications. With the double collection, the applications are about 40 percent of the online sales of restaurants, a slice that grows to 50 percent during discount campaigns. Aeason Law considers that the only way to control excessive charges is through government intervention, as restaurants do not have negotiating power to cope with the prevalence of online platforms. Thus, the representative of the sector expects the executive to elaborate a law that will introduce a mechanism for supervising the online platform action and complaint presentation.

item.title: Islands Hospital | Extended aesthetic and vaccine services
item.description:
The director of health services, Alvis Lo, states that throughout this year will be expanded the aesthetic services and external vaccination consultations of the islands hospital. The future also undergoes cooperation with dealers to bet on more health tourism services
The availability of aesthetic and vaccine services abroad at Hospital das Ilhas will be extended throughout this year. The confirmation of the new services came from Alvis Lo, director of health services, and is the response to a written interpellation of Deputy Lei Chan U. The availability of these services is part of the government's strategy to bet on health tourism, presented as Big Health. As part of this strategy, Alvis Lo explains that the Islands Hospital will “take full advantage of the notoriety of the Peking Union Medical College Hospital brand”, which explores the services available, not only at the level of services provided, but also to collaborate in terms of research and health partnerships. Regarding the services provided, Alvis Lo points out that aesthetics and external vaccines services are currently available. Regarding the area of ​​aesthetics, the doctor points out that "the initial focus lies in facial rejuvenation" is being performed with "resort to the most advanced medical equipment of Hong Kong and Macau". In this service, it is also indicated that “16 therapeutic projects” are being implemented, including using “Picosecond laser” technologies and “radio -ferotement microagulating”. Regarding vaccination, it is indicated that the islands hospital offers five types of vaccines abroad among which the Nanavalent Vaccine against Human Papillomavirus (HPV), the zoster herpes vaccine and the pneumococcal vaccine. Expansion of services Throughout this year, Alvis Lo also points out that the Islands Hospital will “further expand the supply of aesthetic and vaccination medicine projects” and create “new specific external consultation services”, such as “weight loss consultations and cancer prevention”. In the future, Alvis Lo indicates that the path will progressively implement “private ward services” and “Individual Health Management Projects” to achieve “constant progress in medical tourism and Big Health industry”. On the other hand, the doctor indicates that the islands hospital is “attracting more and more tourists to visit Macau” to receive “medical care and health care”. In addition, in response to Chan U law it is indicated that tourism services will launch other “medical tourism services, actively promoting cooperation between the Macao tourist sector and the various integrated tourism and leisure companies for the development of tourist products focused on medical care, well-being and therapeutic food”. Alvis Lo points out will also be “launched several accommodation promotions and the promotion [of medical services] will be intensified with the target markets”.

item.title: Housing | Song Pek Kei asks for subsidies to pay interest
item.description:
The deputy linked to the Fujian community wants the “healthy development” of the real estate market and asks the government to provide more land to build quality houses, and counteract the recent trend
Representative Song Pek Kei argues that the government must make a subsidy available to residents who ended up in the purchase of housing to help them pay interest on the contracted loans. The measure arises in a written interpellation of a deputy linked to the community of Fujian. In the logic of the legislator, it is necessary to finance the payment of loans from those who buy home because the real estate market has a “weak development”, while “consumer power has weakened even more”. "The real estate market in Macau is still relatively slow and the Malparado credit ratio has reached a record level, which affected the stable development of the financial market," he warns. The deputy considers that the reduction in housing prices in recent years should be a concern of society, because it is happening at a time when there is still demand, especially among the younger ones. Therefore, Song wants the government to subsidize the payment of interest on loans, when their amount does not exceed 4 percent. The interest bonus measurement in the purchase of housing in force in Macao in the past, especially in the 1990s and at the beginning of the establishment of the MSAR. In 2001, the measure covered dwellings that were bought for a value of less than 750 thousand patacas. Song Pek Kei considers that this measure was “very successive” and asks for repetition. In an interpeação in which the focus of the deputy is the youngest, the deputy close to Ung Choi Kun, former deputy for the Fujian community and one of the main local voices of real estate interests, also calls for changes in the exemption from the payment of the Seal Tax. Poor housing Song Pek Kei also acknowledges that the construction of latest housing at MSA has created a problem of lack of habitability conditions. According to the deputy, the latest buildings, built as studios or as apartments where there are no divisions demarcated by walls between the living room and the only room, offer decent conditions for residents. "Although there is a certain amount of residential apartments in Macao, there are structural problems in offering good apartments, which is due to the small dimension," he says. Song Pek Kei also recognizes that old housing is more quality than the recent and asks the executive to use the land reserve to allow more construction, this time with the quality that has not been guaranteed in recent years. “The Government of MSAR has a certain land reserve, will management accelerate its planning and adjust the relationship of the supply structure to provide better apartments that satisfy market demand and improve the quality of life of residents?” He asks.

item.title: José Paulo Esperança, Associate Rector of the City of Macau University: “Languages ​​cannot be controlled”
item.description:
Co-author of the “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, with Luís Reto and Fernando Luís Machado, José Paulo Esperança reveals to HM that the work edited in 2016 and 2018 is being updated, especially due to the growing global value of the language. The Associate Rector and Professor of the City of Macao University suggests partnerships with Macau under the Editorial Project
Launched the “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, in co-authorship, about the global value of the language. Plan a new edition or update? Undoubtedly. We are working in this regard, there was a recent conference in Macao and Professor Luís Reto, former Rector of ISCTE, presented some more current elements that were developed. He has worked on a very important issue, which is the role of Portuguese as a frank language, which was for a few centuries in Asia. The exchange between Dutch and the kingdom of Zion was made in Portuguese, because it was the common language used at that time, before English became the contemporary frank language. Therefore, there is a whole interesting story of Portuguese and the role it had in the first pinyins that existed, with the Chinese and the use of the [Roman] alphabet in Vietname. There are a number of elements that are not, therefore, very publicized, and the work of Atlas is the same, to disclose some economic dimensions of the language. What are these dimensions? One is the exchange of foreign trade and investment, which is very facilitated by the language. We also talk about migrations, tourism, students' exchange that is greatly influenced by linguistic proximity. Therefore, today we have a set of elements that are very interesting, and we hope to develop some more important partnerships with Macau. As? More at work, Professor Luís Reto is doing, which maintains an investigation team about the value of Portuguese. He has collaborated with the Portuguese Language Museum of São Paulo, for example. It is a museum space that was renewed after the fire that destroyed it. In addition, there is a project with Cascais City Council to develop such a structure, and we hope to do some works with Macau, in order to create three poles for the projection of the Portuguese language. As for Atlas' materials, we would like to have a continued update model, as this data is out of date very quickly. The work was edited in many languages, including Mandarin. This is the moment when we would like to give the book a more historical and deep dimension, with more knowledge about the teaching of Portuguese in the world. What balance does this teaching do today? Portuguese is developing a great deal of mother tongue and is effectively one of the most expanding languages ​​due to demographic growth in Africa, with countries such as Angola and Mozambique, which around 2050 will have populations of over 100 million inhabitants, each. The Portuguese thus consolidates itself as a language of the southern hemisphere, but much more from Africa, supplanting Brazil itself as the place of largest number of speakers of the language. All of this generates enormous potential, and this also occurs due to the great exchange of universities and internationalization of teaching. Today there is the possibility of Portuguese being a language of science, there is more publications in this language. This is a great challenge because English is the contemporary language of scientists. We want to contribute to all these dimensions, and Macau can also play an important role there. Macao is indeed a platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, and can play a significant role. Is Macao an ideal place to train Portuguese teachers who do not have Portuguese as a mother tongue? Do you fear that the territory loses relevance in this matter before the offer of courses in the interior of China? I see this question more as complementarity than competition. We have identified about 60 higher education institutions in China that have Portuguese courses, but I think Macau has very interesting conditions to start teaching from primary to secondary education so that children have been able to have learning from an early age. It does not mean that there are no young Chinese who began to learn their tongue in adolescence that they speak fantastically, which surprises me, but it is easier to start earlier and earlier. This will be easier in Macau. What is important is to create conditions for greater economic collaboration to many levels, such as joint research. In this respect, Macau has a very interesting opportunity. At the City of Macau University we are very interested in increasingly collaborating with researchers who visit us and work with our teams. Can you give me examples? Brazil is today one of China's great business partners. There is a lot of exchange in both directions, but one of the themes that is little studied, and in which I work hard, is the internationalization of Chinese companies. To what extent do these companies follow a model of internationalization similar to that of other countries that started this process earlier? I speak of the United States of America, the European countries, but also of Japan and others. China has, in fact, different models of presence in countries that are not yet well known, and this is important to realize, so that we know how to facilitate this process of exchange in a world that lives periods of some setback. It is very sad. I always remember a great economist of Portuguese origin, David Ricardo, who clearly explained how world trade is beneficial to everyone and how countries can take advantage of this situation. Therefore, applying tariffs, making such commercial barriers harms countries that are major exporters, such as China or Germany, and countries that today have a cultural export capacity, for example, and are not just importers. In relation to the new Orthographic Agreement. It continues without a standardization in Macau. Does it worry it? Languages ​​are dynamic and cannot be controlled. We think today in English, and we realize that there are almost incomprehensible ways to each other, such as the English one in Nigeria or Australia. Americans have difficulty realizing the Australians. In the nineteenth century, Portuguese from Portugal and Brazil were closer, then some disagreement emerged. There was an effort in Brazil to propose an orthographic agreement, and the Portuguese joined, resulting in a series of negotiations. There have always been resistances. I remember that Fernando Pessoa suggested the famous phrase “My homeland is the Portuguese language”. It was curiously a manifestation of some conservatism, because he thought Pharmacy had to continue writing with pH [Pharmacia]. In fact it did not make much sense. Portugal ended up seeking to impose a certain standardization based on the most genetic changes in the spelling agreement. It is not a process that has been running a hundred percent well, and has been universally adopted. African countries have become more defenders of Portuguese from Portugal. There is sometimes some confusion, but I understand that intercomprehension still remains, achieving a homogeneous language, more perhaps than English.
Between words and numbers José Paulo Esperança is a doctorate in Economics from the European University Institute and was president of the ISCTE Department of Finance and Accounting - University Institute of Lisbon. The “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, with editions in 2016 and 2018, contains “a large set of indicators that reinforce the idea of ​​the growth of teaching, speakers and the written use of Portuguese in the world”, having been the target of a series of recent initiatives in Macao. One of them took place on March 17, at the Rui Cunha Foundation, with a session of the “Roda de Ideas” cycle, entitled “The Potential of the Portuguese Language in the Contemporary World”, which was attended by the former ISCTE Rector, Luís Reto, and José Paulo Hope himself. In addition to the “New Atlas of the Portuguese Language”, José Paulo Esperança is the author of other works in the financial area.

item.title: South Korean artist Shin Min wins first edition of “MGM Discoveries”
item.description: Shin Min, South Korean artist, was the winner of the first edition of the MGM Discoveries Art Award, awarded together by MGM and Art Basel de Hong Kong. According to a MGM statement, the artist, represented by Seoul's P21 gallery, won with an “innovative installation”, named “Ew! There is Hair in the Food !!!”, in which he used “a powerful symbolism and personal experiences to confront social norms and systemic injustices”. According to the same note, Shin Min "expects this work to serve as a powerful tool to sensitize society and ultimately improve the working conditions of the population." The prize includes a monetary value of $ 50,000 and the "opportunity to be invited by MGM to hold an exhibition and participate in artistic exchanges in Macao." The objective of the “MGM Discoveries” award is “to promote artistic diversity and connect Hong Kong, Macau and the world through iconic cultural events”, and this initiative “recognizes the originality and innovation of emerging international artists”, as well as “expanding their visibility in the global art world”. Shared views Kenneth Feng, president and executive director of MGM China Holdings Limited, said “MGM and Art Basel Hong Kong share the common vision of promoting global artistic and cultural development”, and this joint award “is a commitment to discovering emerging artists and celebrating its originality and creativity, offering a platform to develop its potential and grow”. "In addition, through international cultural efforts, Macau is closely united with Hong Kong and the global stage, expanding the global network and the exchange of Macao," said the official. Angelle Siyang-Le, director of Art Basel Hong Kong, said that the jury chose "Shin Min from a remarkable set of artists presented in the" Sector Discoveries ", which highlights emerging artists and galleries through individual presentations of recent projects." MGM also organized a guided tour of Art Basel de Hong Kong, one of the most important art fairs in the world, for about 50 Macao's cultural and educational representatives. With this award, the game operator says she wants to “bring new artistic perspectives to Macau and the Great Bay”, as well as “a variety of international artistic and cultural activities”.

item.title: XI Jinping stimulates investment in meeting with foreign entrepreneurs
item.description: On the morning of Friday, March 28, XI Jinping met with “representatives of the international business community” at the Great People's Hall in Beijing. “The reason I have invited all present is to hear your ideas, respond to your concerns and support the development of foreign companies in China,” explained the president in the initial words of his intervention, paying tribute to the numerous benefits that foreign companies brought to the country. "China's impressive achievements are not only due to the Communist Party and the Chinese people, but also to the support and help of the international community, including the contribution of foreign companies operating in China," said XI. "Foreign companies represent a third of China's total imports and exports, a quarter of their industrial value added and a seventh of their tax revenues, creating more than 30 million jobs," he explained. For Xi, foreign companies are “important participants in Chinese modernization, the country's renovation, opening and innovation, and their interconnectivity with the world and integration into economic globalization”. Therefore, “here I would like to express my sincere gratitude to all the foreign companies that participated and supported the development of China!” He concluded. Many will say that the Chinese president is, in the background, to respond to the growing pessimism of multinational companies in relation to the Chinese market, evidenced by the fall in foreign direct investment. Xi acknowledged, although diplomatically, that "in recent years, foreign companies have indeed found some difficulties in their development in China." Facing the problem directly is undoubtedly better than pretending it does not exist. But it was more detailed than ever, for example, by recognizing that multinationals often cannot access business opportunities despite role market openings. “We will work to resolve the issue of 'large open doors, but small closed doors' in market access, ensuring that companies with foreign investment are not only able to go into open sectors, but also enjoy full and fair access to operations.” The president acknowledged that multinationals are often discriminated against, stressing that it has long been that “foreign companies in China should benefit from national treatment, with equal application of laws, equal status and equal treatment. We will ensure that foreign companies have fair and legal access to production factors”, admitting that multinationals cannot often benefit from public contracts in China, promising: promising: "We will ensure that products manufactured in China by foreign companies can participate in public contracts on an equal foot, according to the law." Trump a and the WTO Many will say that Xi is taking advantage of Trump's shock. Their comments are normal for Chinese standards, including "many foreign companies, especially multinational companies, have a substantial global influence. We hope to speak right, act with pragmatism, firmly oppose retrograde movements that retreat the clock of history, reject zero -sum and promote cooperation and mutual benefit." While Trump suspends US financing for the World Trade Organization (WTO), Xi reinforces the WTO: “The multilateral trade system, with the World Trade Organization at its core, is the cornerstone of international trade… We must defend the principles and rules of the WTO, continue to advance the liberalization and facilitation of trade and investment and encourage all countries to expand the development of shared development through greater opening. Xi also promised greater internal opening: “The reduction of the market access threshold will be a key priority in the next opening phase. I specifically stressed that opening measures should be completed earlier than later. This year, we will widen the opening programs in selected areas and accelerate opening in sectors such as culture and education.” XI has promised that China is not interested in any military conflict, stating that "it will be unobailably a path of peaceful development, it will actively promote the resolution of important international and regional issues and will strive to create a favorable environment for foreign companies." On Friday night, Beijing promptly announced the full comments of Xi, beyond his usual reading. This is a sign of the emphasis given to meetings with foreign companies. Complete comments also help, as they serve as a reference, more officially and conveniently, for cunning political operators, including, expecting, experts in governmental matters and public relations of multinationals, who should use them as a valuable tool in their transactions in China. Of the foreign participants at the meeting with XI, 14 of the 38 were Americans, 10 Germans, 6 British, 3 French, 2 Japanese, 2 Koreans and one from Switzerland, Denmark, Sweden, Brazil and Saudi Arabia. Despite BRICS and Global South, when it comes to foreign and multinational investment, the West continues to play a central role. Foreigners gathered are officially described by China as “representatives of the international business community”. “Security Oasis” FedEx Corporation President Raj Subrmaniam, Mercedes-Benz Group AG chairman, hello Källenius, Sanofi SA executive director Paul Hudson, HSBC Holdings PLC executive director, Georges Elhedery, Hitachi Ltd. Tosiaki Executive President SK Hynix Inc. Kwak Noh-Jung, and the President of Saudi Aramco Amin Nasser were some of those who intervened at the meeting. Os representantes das empresas estrangeiras “elogiaram a China por ter alcançado um crescimento económico estável através de uma reforma profunda e abrangente e de uma abertura de alto nível sob a liderança do Presidente Xi”, refere a Xinhua. From “Made in China” to “new quality productive forces”, China has enhanced industrial transformation and modernization through innovation, being prepared to perform a higher quality and more sustainable development. The perspectives of the Chinese economy are strong, because in the midst of growing protectionism, China has continually expanding its opening, injecting stability in the global economy, and has become a "oasis of certainty" for investment and entrepreneurship. "China's development is the main driving force of the world economy and offers vast and exciting opportunities and growth potential," he was mentioned. According to Xinhua, foreign representatives “applauded Chinese government efforts to create a fair and favorable environment for foreign companies and expressed their availability to expand investment cooperation with China, cultivate the Chinese market, actively participate in the modernization of China and build bridges for the exchange and cooperation of China with the world, and also expressed their availability to support an open world market, defend international free trade and contribute to the development of the world economy. ”

item.title: Portsmouth will investigate maritime energy transition in Macau
item.description: Macao was one of the places selected by the University of Portsmouth to study the inheritance of the energy transition in the coastal communities of the global southern and how they cross the age of decarbonization, the project officer told Lusa. After the Port of Callao, in the center of Peru, Macau was the choice of the University of Portsmouth in the United Kingdom to investigate as maritime communities from the so -called global south crossed one of the milestones of the Industrial Revolution, the transition from sail to steam. Relief commercial warehouse, Macao has a very rich story linked to the sea, a factor that weighed on the center's decision and maritime cultures (PCMC, British acronym) at the British University. "It is probably one of the first European enclaves in East Asia and has a long history of international travel by the sea from 1500," Melanie Bassett researcher Lusa told Lusa. The creation of a doctoral research scholarship will bring to the territory an academic, whose mission is still to understand how these communities can adapt to a sustainable future. "We then want to look at the new energy transitions, to decarbonization, how Macau is making this transition and if people are aware of the changes," added Bassett, who leads the project "From Steam to Green to Green: Empower port communities in the global south [Sail to Steam, Carbon to Green: Empowering Port Communitiesin The Global South]" Portsmouth. The project, which extends for a period of six and a half years, started in February, with the investigation to focus on the Peruvian Port of Callao, but should later expand to two other regions “somewhere in the Indian subcontinent and West Africa”. Understand the past Only the investigation will bring tangible results, but Bassett points out that, with the primacy of the steam vessel, the travel of communities and industries were generally away from the sea waterfront. Changes have also occurred in several businesses linked to the sector, from the fishing industry to naval construction. “We anticipate seeing this kind of changes, but also with the advent of European colonization, we see changes in cultures and architecture and how it affects the population, and then how, over time, these cultures merge and hybridize to create new cultures and new understandings of the world,” he said. “It's part of Lloyds Register Foundation's financing to learn from the past,” Bassett added, referring to the project's funder who, in the case of Macao, will have the collaboration of the University of Macao and the local Maritime Museum. It is also expected to have the communities active in research. Therefore, the recruitment of the academic that will lead the investigation requires language skills to ensure communication with the population. Recruitment for this research that is divided between Portsmouth and Macau is expected to be completed in April, and the project starts in October.

item.title: Today Macau
item.description: Chinese oil company Cnooc discovered an important oil field in the east of the Southern Sea of ​​China, with proven reserves of over 100 million tons, the state press said yesterday. According to Chinese official news agency Xinhua, the identified field, Huizhou 19-6, is about 170 kilometers from the city of Shenzhen in the south of the country. Test drilling produced 413 barrels of raw and 68,000 cubic meters of natural gas per day, according to the same source. Proven reservations of the oil field, ie the amount of hydrocarbons whose recovery can be almost certainly estimated using current techniques, ascend to more than 100 million tons, according to the information cited by Xinhua. Southern China's underground is largely sub-pitched due to territorial disputes, but most known oil and gas deposits are in non-contested areas, according to the US energy information administration. Beijing claims the sovereignty of almost the whole sea, over which the Philippines, Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia and Brunei also have claims.

item.title: MNE | BIR OF PORTUGUESE AND EPM are topics to discuss with Paulo Rangel
item.description:
During the visit to Macao of Portuguese Foreign Minister, Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to discuss the end of access to BIR access by Portuguese. The president of the House of Portugal in Macau associates this article with the position of Lisbon in the issue of 5G
It is another visit of a Portuguese ruler to Macau, but Paulo Rangel's first as Minister of Foreign Affairs of the executive of Luis Montenegro, at a time when the country is preparing to go to votes in May after the dissolution of the Assembly of the Republic. After a journey through China, Paulo Rangel will meet with local associative leaders in order to perceive existing problems related to the Portuguese community. At HM, Amelia António, president of the House of Portugal in Macau (CPM), argues that the difficulties of obtaining residence by Portuguese should be one of the pressing matters. “My expectation is not high. I would like the Minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the positions of the European Union (EU) so fierce, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. of the EU, and this should not be lost sight of. ” Amelia António highlights the position that Portugal adopted in the case of Rede 5G and Huawei, but also “the development that occurred in relation to the coming of Portuguese to Macau, subject to Blue Card”. “I have the feeling that everything comes following this EU policy against China. Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. "We are here, we suffer the consequences of these relationships [between Portugal and China], good or bad. We had very close relations for a long time, which changed with Covid. I have not seen things again as they were, and I think it was important that Mr. Minister explains what is the position," he said that Portugal does not have to "align faithfully with everything in Europe and, above all," Before the pandemic, he recalled the official, there was “permanent communication” and “much exchange” between the Portuguese and Chinese authorities. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in macao immigration, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this removal” between China and the West. Macao authorities have not accepted new requests for residence in the territory for Portuguese for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing for justification of family reunion or previous connection to the territory. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. "I would like the government of the Portuguese Republic to take into account the Portuguese community in the territory, which faces some difficulties regarding the possibility of obtaining the residence. It is a topic that may be addressed between the Portuguese State and the MSAR, to be greater flexibility to allow the Portuguese community to have greater accessibility to the right of residence, as existed before." For the causal, "Misrere does not have to randomly assign more homes, but it is something that corresponds only to my desire." "Of course, that Mand has its reasons and Macau is different, and there are other communities that are interested in staying in the territory. The Portuguese community, due to greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still another community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It is a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In choosing correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one of green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work poorly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December a pilot electronic voting experience in the circles of emigration. The head of Portuguese diplomacy arrives in Macau today after passing by Beijing and Haikou, in the province of Haião, where he was present at the Boao Forum. In Macao, Paulo Rangel has scheduled meetings with the head of local government, Sam Hou Fai, as well as the counselors of the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Visit the EPM and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, MNE goes to Hong Kong to visit “Lusas Stories”, an exhibition dedicated to the Portuguese community at the Hong Kong History Museum. Lame

item.title: Apomac | Jorge Fão regrets lack of people to manage association
item.description:
APOMAC - Macao's retirees, retired and pensioners association goes to elections tomorrow with a unique list. Francisco Mannão competes again for president, Jorge Fão for the General Assembly and Daniel Mendonça to the Fiscal Council. Mannão suggests the creation of a “satellite city” only for the elderly and calls for pensions update
Increasing the elderly pensions would be "gold on blue." In the meantime, Francisco Mannão continues to fight for this and other flags designed to improve the lives of older residents, again leading the candidate list for the management of Apomac - Macao's retirees, retirees and pensioners association, which take place tomorrow. The list is unique and the faces have little or nothing difference from previous years: Jorge Fão continues to lead the General Assembly, while Daniel Mendonça competes for the Fiscal Council. There is only one new name in the position of Member of the Fiscal Council. "It is very difficult to find people available to do this volunteer work. Jorge and I would like to find someone who could replace us, because we are for a long time in this association. We are elderly, but we have energy. As long as we have strength on the legs to walk, we are walking and trying to do our best by Apomac," Francisco Mannhão told HM. Jorge Fão highlights the fact that Apomac has been about to celebrate 25 years since the foundation, noting that there is, in fact, a leadership problem that if not solved can culminate in the disappearance of the association. "We are not seeing the emergence of another list of younger and younger people, so that we offer our services for another term and so on, as far as possible. There is a leading problem at Apomac and in other associations. The Apomac issue is more serious, because we have been standing for 24 years, we will celebrate in May." Satellite city and pensions In a list that will lead the association by 2028, the motto is “we are elderly but energetic”, reads in the action program. At the first point, it is indicated that the team's objective is "to monitor the government's policy and the Macau Foundation, with a view to adjusting the needs of our action program throughout this three -year term." In addition, they intend to "provide the necessary support to members so that they can enjoy the benefits awarded by the Government of MSAR and other official entities." One of the requests on the list to the government led by Sam Hou Fai is the increase in pensions, which is currently 3,740 patacas. It would be for the association would be the update to four thousand monthly patacas. "It would be good for the government of MSar to pay the pension monthly to the elderly, the pecuniary compensation and the old age, instead of having to wait every three months to receive the pension for the elderly, seven months to receive the pecuniary compensation and ten months to receive old age. Hm. Another idea left by Francisco Mannão is from the construction of a satellite city only for elderly dwellings, in what would be a larger project against residence for the elderly already built by the executive, in the area of ​​sand black. "I liked the Government of MSA to build a satellite city for the elderly. I worry a lot because there are many living alone, and with the construction of this satellite city they no longer have problems of loneliness, and could live with each other, and can provide services common to all. The construction of high buildings is good, but for the elderly it is not that good," he defended. Still, Mannão assures that being elderly in Macau is much easier than in Hong Kong. “Nowadays, in Macau, the elderly live quite well, because there are many social support attributed to this group of people. Sufficient resources Asked about the essential points to make Apomac a larger association, Francisco Mannhão says that “they have enough”, however, the closure of the clinic where they were provided to the elderly health care. "Of course we had the plan to be able to develop our headquarters more, but due to the lack of the allowance we had to end our clinic. In this context, we had a program to develop this area that had to be abandoned, and that would benefit our associates. We tried to organize more lectures about health, because the senior group needs to know more about disease and health affairs, something that can generate great concerns." In political terms, Francisco Mannhão, who was even a candidate for deputy to the Legislative Assembly, says that Apomac is an advocate of the principle of “one country, two systems”, thought by Beijing to the regions of Macau and Hong Kong. "We agree with the national policy of 'a country, two systems', so that Macau can be a paradise for us. So far we have been quite well in Macau, we have no problems, but we would like this principle to continue." A lot of bureaucracy One of the services provided by Apomac goes through bureaucratic support to the elderly in communication with the General Retirement Caixa (CGA), in the case of former civil servants who receive the reform of Portugal, or the Macao Pension Fund. "The communication with the CGA has improved a little, but the bureaucratic part is still very difficult to deal with on the part of our associates. Not long ago one of our associates waited more than three years for an amount of an amount that has been improperly charged," said Francisco Mannão. Jorge Fão, in turn, stressed that Apomac is also popular with non -partners, including from the Chinese community, to treat various issues, such as requests for subsidies or funeral -related paperwork. Still looking at the Action program, Apomac's list also aims to “organize more sightseeing tours to mainland China, making known its culture and success of the country”, as well as the promotion of “more coexistence, so that members join periodically”. Much sought after by the dining service, since in Apomac some dishes of macanese gastronomy can be eaten, the list wants to "improve the management of the canteen whenever possible." Asked if many elderly from Macau want to pass the renovation in China one day, at a time when regional integration is increasingly a reality, Francisco Mannão admits yes, although many “prefer to stay in the territory, as they have their life rooted here, being used to the uses and customs of Macao”. "The Government of MSA has been doing a lot of work so that they can join the great bay," he said.

item.title: BOAO FORUM | Ia, globalization and sustainability in discussion
item.description:
Another edition of the Boao Forum began in Haião, where topics such as artificial intelligence, globalization, current economic issues and sustainable development will be discussed. The head of the Executive of Masters departs today for the event, whose theme is “Asia in the world in transformation: towards a shared future”
Posters to announce another edition of the Boao Forum can be seen everywhere in Haião, the Chinese island that hosts the International Forum promoted by Beijing to discuss, with other countries, issues of economic, commercial and cooperation at various levels. The MSAR will be represented by an official delegation led by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, who will be on the island between today and tomorrow. Liu Xianfa, commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Popular Republic of China in the MSAR, continues to join the delegation of MGA as a guest advisor. The official delegation of the MSAR is also composed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, and the chief executive chief of the cabinet, Chan Kak. During the absence of Sam Hou Fai, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, will interim the functions of Chief Executive. The Boa Goveal Forum for Asia 2025 ends on Friday and has as its theme “Asia in the world in transformation: Towards a shared future” [Asia in the Changing World: Tows a Shared Future], and, according to a statement released by the chief executive's office, focuses on four essential areas, one of them “rebuilding confidence and promoting cooperation in a rapid transformation world”. Objectives are followed by "encouraging growth and rebalanced globalization for inclusive development" or "modeling the future and rapidly implementing the objectives of sustainable development to respond more effectively to global challenges." In turn, the fourth objective concerns a very current area: Artificial Intelligence (AI). It is thus intended to “explore potentialities and intensify AI's application and governance for development motivated by innovation”. According to the People's Daily Journal, this year are expected for more than two thousand participants from 60 countries and regions, being held 50 forums, or discussion groups, around the above objectives. 1,140 journalists are expected to coverage the event. The forecasts of a forum The main conferences of the Boao Forum include discussions about the Chinese and World Economy, namely in "High-Level dialogue: China's reform and economic predictions" and "construction of an open world economy: challenges and solutions." Following is “Improvement of the construction of digital capacity & conforming the gap between digital”, as well as “unlock the great potential of regional free trade agreements”. Among the remaining panels are also conversations about the potential of AI in "AI: how to ensure a balance between application and governance." Countries will also address the issue of global governance in the relationship with the United Nations (UN), in "high-level dialogue: global governance after the UN summit of the future." But the discussion forums start with some predictions made in the report released in the context of the Boao Forum, entitled "Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress". One of the forecasts is that the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the Asian continent should grow 4.5 percent this year, reported Xinhua. "Despite growing global economic uncertainty, Asia remains a key growth engine for the world economy," the report says. In addition, in terms of parity of purchasing power, the Asia GDP ratio, within the world total, is expected to increase from a registration of 48.1 percent last year to 48.6 percent this year. In turn, the report describes that the general situation of employment and wages “is improving in Asia”, with an unemployment rate of 4.39 percent for this year, below the global rate of 4.96 percent. The Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress also highlights foreign investments in Asia, describing that China and Asean-Association of Southeast Asia nations "are the most appealing economies in Asia." In addition, it refers that the dependence on the internal and external foreign direct and external investment of Asian economies in the region itself reached 49.15 percent by 2023. From the point of view of the bidirectional dependence of IDE in Asia, China continued to be the most dependent economy of the Asian IDE flows, followed by Indonesia, with its dependence rates over 80 percent and 75 percent, respectively. The report also pointed out that China remains the center of global production value chains, and since 2017, global trade in intermediate goods has been more dependent on China than in North America. In 2023, China's global dependence on intermediate goods was 16 percent compared to 15 percent to North America. The commercial friction caused by the United States in 2018 did not raise their position in the global value chains of the transforming industry, the report added. Thus, the advance of Asia is also described in the level of emerging green technologies, since this is "driven by strong industrial capabilities and political support." Thus, the continent seems to be positioning itself "as a potential leader in advanced materials related to batteries or production of biodegradable plastics." China, Japan, and the Republic of Korea dominate the Lithium Battery Battery Technology Global Supply Chain, a factor considered crucial for the electrification of transport, the report underlines. However, China is at the forefront of the expanding green hydrogen industry in Asia, being the region responsible for almost 70 percent of the worldwide capacity of hydrogen electrolisters, also reveals the same report. An ecological island According to an Xinhua report, Haião Island, which welcomes the Boao Forum, is “a pioneer in development with low carbon emissions”, namely the use of photovoltaic energy. "On Dongyu Island, in Hainan province, southern China, the almost null carbon emissions demonstration zone is redefining harmony between humanity and nature-remodeling modern life through the integration of cutting-edge technology with sustainable development," he describes. But there are more technological news, such as the use of "a simple QR code that unlocks a coffee carbon emissions experience, and where a robotic arm prepares coffee using clean energy." There is also the bet on recycling, as "an advanced recycling cube separates the materials, converting them into" carbon points ", which can be changed to ecological awards." The area that welcomes the Boao Forum has a total area of ​​190 hectares, where a bet on “three key strategies” was made, namely the “renewal of ecological buildings, use of renewable energy and ecological transport”. The renewal of the zone for more sustainable bets will have begun in 2022, being proof of “how technological innovation and urban renewal can shape a future with low carbon emissions, paving the way for sustainable development, particularly in the tropical regions of the world,” says Xinhua. Also according to the same report, "one of the main strengths of the area lies in energy production capacity", currently producing "about 32 million kWh of green electricity, almost double its search for 17 million kWh". In turn, "surplus energy is introduced into the network, contributing to an annual savings of 7 720 tons of negative carbon resources," he said to Xinhua Ouyang Qinglun, deputy director of the Cosco Shipping Boao Co.
