item.title: EPM | Paulo Rangel guarantees increased financial support after 11 years of cuts
item.description:
On a lightning visit to Macao, Portugal's Foreign Minister argued that the position that the country maintains in the European Union does not affect the relationship with China. During Paulo Rangel's visit, it was also announced that Sam Hou Fai should visit Portugal during the summer
He met with Sam Hou Fai, with counselors from the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, Portuguese educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Thus was the visit of Paulo Rangel, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, in the short visit to the MSAR, which took place on Friday. There are no passages in the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, Paulo Rangel also moved to Hong Kong to visit the exhibition “Lusas Stories”, dedicated to the Portuguese community of the territory, patent at the Hong Kong History Museum. In China, Paulo Rangel was present at the Boao Forum in Haião. In an interview with TDM, the minister assured that Portugal's relations with China remain good, denying that the country's position in the European Union's position (EU) can represent some kind of obstacle. "Anyone who thinks that Portugal's presence in the EU is harmful to Portugal's relationship with China, does not realize Portugal's relationship with China and does not realize the role of Portugal in the international picture. I realize that some people do not understand, but honestly we have to see it as more value. And this is seen like this," he said. One of the voices that criticized Portugal's position in relation to stories such as the issue of Huawei and Rede 5G was Amelia António, lawyer and president of the House of Portugal in Macau. “My expectation is not high. I would like you minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the EU positions, so fiercely, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. It should not be lost sight of, ”he told Paulo Rangel to Macao. The EPM question In the interview given to TDM, Paulo Rangel also commented on the issue of EPM, stressing the points that were not on the agenda, namely the works of expansion of the facilities. "This question has not yet been addressed. There are, in fact, several issues that have to be detailed and resolved, and one or the other that have not yet been put on the table. We know that there is search for it, but and I am being totally transparent, it is a question that is not yet on the table." According to Lusa, Paulo Rangel also announced that the government increased financial support to the EPM, returning to the legally expected level after 11 years of cuts. "We just replaced the Portuguese contribution to the Portuguese School of Macao, which (…) had suffered a huge cut," Rangel said on Friday. The Portuguese State holds the majority (51 percent) of the capital of the EPM foundation, but since 2014 that Lisbon only contributed with 10 percent of school expenses, a decision taken under the Portuguese financial rescue program. EPM financing “is now at legal levels again and is the first time at the end of 11 years,” he said. Shortly thereafter, the chief of Portuguese diplomacy told reporters that "there was no reason, honestly, to have this cut and he remained." "We have increased five times this value [of EPM financing], so this is something that is highly significant from the commitment we have." "There are governments that really give importance to Macau and China and there are others who do not give, this is something that has to be said," lamented the minister, pointing his finger at the previous executive of the Socialist Party. The replacement of financing “is undoubtedly an important help” for EPM, which Rangel described as having a key role for Portugal in Macau. "We also have pleased ... that there have never been so many Portuguese students - and now I speak of students from the Chinese community - as there are today in multiple schools," added the leader. "It means that also the special administrative region [of Macau] has encouraged Portuguese teaching and knowledge of Portuguese, and this is something that can only bring good relations between the two sides," added Rangel. SAM in Portugal From the meeting with Sam Hou Fai, which also took place on Friday, some ideas and opinions on “bilateral exchange and cooperation in the judicial, economic-commercial, education, among others,” says an official note from the Social Communication Office. Sam Hou Fai led to the meeting topics such as “the most current development of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Henqing”, and remembered that “Paulo Rangel is the first foreign ministerial guardian he receives after the executive's head of the executive, a fact that reflects the good relations between Macao and Portugal with a longtime history”. The head of the executive also pointed out that after December 20, 1999, Macau, "with strong support from the central government, has insisted on maintaining the principle of" a country, two systems ", preserving the continental legal system, traditional culture and customs, as well as actively maintaining the connection and foster relations with Portugal." The ruler also said that "Macao has deepened the role of bridge and platform between China and Lusophone countries, continuously boosting the establishment of friendly relationships in the various areas of bilateral cooperation." Another novelty of this meeting was the information, advanced by Sam Hou Fai himself, which “expects to visit Portugal in the near future” without, however, a concrete date has been announced. Rangel announced that the chief executive of Macao is expected to visit Portugal "immediately before August or in September." "There is clearly here also an alignment of the priorities that is highly symbolic," said the diplomat, on the fringes of a meeting with the Portuguese community in Macau. Asked about the restrictions to Portuguese in accessing the resident status, Rangel said he spoke with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the MSAR." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can, with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other, now we have space and time to build solutions," he added. Rangel said that the "follow -up of dialogue" with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal -Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized in principle in the second semester here in Macao." Paulo Rangel also said, in an interview with TDM, that the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, “will happen a little later”, precisely due to the marking of new elections in the country. Initially, the aim was that Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa came to Macao in June to commemorate Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. The visit should take place in the following months of summer, predicted Paulo Rangel. Encounters and mismatches Paulo Rangel also had a meeting with local associative representatives, including with the Portuguese communities counselor. Francisco Mannhão, president of the Macao Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners Association (Apomac), took the opportunity to talk about the bureaucracy that still exists in the relationship with the Caixa Geral de Retirement (CGA). "To dispatch a survival pension process takes six months and then the correspondence goes back and forth. Macao benches do not have Iban, and this, for example, delays the whole process. Whenever a process goes to CGA, they insist that they do not have the number of IBAN and NIF [Fiscal Identification Number], that most of the widows receiving survival pensions, do not have in Portugal." exemplified. Mannão also compliments to the Portuguese politician. "For a short time he was here, he showed concern. I liked the presence of the minister." In addition, Francisco Mannão stressed that “in a good time the Portuguese government appointed Alexandre Leitão to Consul”, also recalling the good work of the previous Portuguese consul, Vítor Sereno. "The consulate has never been as well functioned as now. The criticism made to our consul are unfair. There were our associates who told me to have been admired for making a marking and was attended the next day," he said. More bet on the language Another important point of Rangel's visit was the promise of the reinforcement of Mandarin teaching in Portugal. "With the Chinese authorities I made a point of saying that we will be very committed to teaching Chinese in Portugal." In the Chinese capital, Rangel met with Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, before meeting with Chinese vice-minister, Ding Xuexiang, on Hailão Island, where the Boao Forum took place. "The situation today is much better than it was 20 years ago ... We have, in fact, a formation that we did not have at all," said Paulo Rangel. The formation of fluent people in Mandarin “is also decisive for our future”, but “it is not enough for the challenges we have ahead,” he warned. Lame

item.title: History | Lara Reis, Professor of Macao High School, remembered in Lisbon
item.description:
The former teacher of the Macao High School Fernando Lara Reis was remembered in the “Spring Conferences”, from the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center, by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira. A native of Leiria, Lara Reis fought in the 1st World War and lived on Avenida da República, in the villa that today houses the Macau Red Cross house
Fernando Lara Reis was born in 1892 and died in 1950. Throughout a life filled with historical events and testimonies, the natural man of Leiria was a military man and a teacher at Macao High School, eventually making the territory his home. Lara Reis's life was recently remembered at the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira, herself to her former teacher in the territory. At the session, the historian, who won the 2024 Macao International Institute Identity Award (IIM), recalled the “teacher, meritorious, driving of the arts”, and owner of “unusual knowledge”. “He was a native of Leiria and lived in Macao until his death. He attended Leiria High School, the Military College, then joined the Army School. In World War I was in Elvas, and then left to Angola in 1915 when he faced the German threat over Portuguese colonies in Africa. Observer-Aviator. ” Lara Reis was never a pilot as she wanted, having dedicated much of her life to teaching and Macao. “In 1919, Lara Reis went to Macao High School. He took a long circum-gap trip, leaving Portugal from Lisbon, going to the United States of America, crossed the entire territory and then went to Japan, down to Hong Kong and even Macau. He was a teacher in Macao, drawing, handicrafts and gymnastics until the end of his life,” said Celina Veiga de Oliveira. The historian took to the session some written testimonies left by other Macao figures who wrote about Lara Reis, namely Monsignor Manuel Teixeira in the book “Macao Lyceu”. He said he never found "no teacher who had served the High School with greater dedication." “He was a rigorous methodical teacher, whose military formation was certainly not oblivious to these characteristics. What was truly standing out was his artistic vein, because Lara Reis was always concerned with ascertaining the aesthetic meaning of the students and opening their mental horizons. This at the time when Macau was a small town. that he organized and also exhibitions by Portuguese and foreign artists he sponsored, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira also highlighted the words left by the writer Henrique de Senna Fernandes in an interview on "one of the greatest qualities of Lara Reis", which "besides rigor and discipline, was the consideration by the students, not distinguishing rich from the poor." Professor Lara Reis was "a party prosecutor who served to obtain tuition fees for needy students," and "he is due to the initiative of the creation of the High School Association, of which he was the first president." This association organized in the former canhydrome “sports parties of the end of the year when students performed the most difficult exercises”. Work done in Macau The historian also highlighted “another aspect of dedication to territory” by Lara Reis. The Leiriense "participated in the First World War and this led him to interest all those who were incorporated into this conflict, having founded the League of the Great War fighters and had built in the cemetery of St. Miguel Archangel the monument where the bodies of combatants rest." Moreover, "another facet of his personality was a taste for travel, because he had no family and thus left for the world." "I visited museums, art schools and photographed everything I saw, having created a estate with 32 volumes that is now a heritage of Leiria." Celina Veiga de Oliveira did not forget the old “Sol Pente” villa, located in the middle-leaf zone, namely the Avenida da República, which was the house of Lara Reis, later donated to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao to “an anti-cancer clinic that was the first institution of the genre in the Portuguese colonial space”. Today this villa serves as a house to the Red Cross of Macao, and on its walls you can find a stone with the following message: “In this building legacy by the Rotary Fernando Reis to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao, it was installed at the initiative of the Rotary Club of Macao the first anti-cancer fighting center on April 15, 1951.” “Change of Ares” When Fernando Lara Reis goes to Macao, political times are troubled, with the political agitation to be lived in China after the fall of the Empire and the Republican Revolution of 1911. "In the 1920s the nationalist shock waves lived in the Canton, which sometimes haunted the Portuguese enclave quiet, but never moved with everyday life. The Portuguese administration guaranteed a standard appearance, and the parties at Christmas, Chinese New Year, the religious festivities of the Catholic community and the Chinese population were habitual." Celina Veiga de Oliveira recalled that in the late 1920s, Lara Reis decided to transfer to Goa, a trip that would only accentuate her belonging to Macau. “In the late 1920s, he felt he was time to change his air and asked to be transferred to the Afonso de Albuquerque High School in Pangim, and was there between 1941 and 1945, taking the opportunity to know India, and met the whole country. Instead, with a graceful and already sick license, choosing Macau to be his last address, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira recordou também as palavras de Orlando Cardoso, que no artigo “Macau e o Oriente na vida de Lara Reis” falou do homem que se deslumbrou com Macau “a partir do momento em que, às 8 horas da noite de 23 de Outubro de 1919, avistou pela primeira vez o Farol da Guia, um pouco antes de se instalar no ‘New Macao Hotel’ e sorver de sentidos atentos os sons, os cheiros e as luzes desta porta of an immeasurable and fantastic Asia that he would describe to exhaustion. ” These Lara Reis testimonies are “in a remarkable set of travel books that lay virtually unexplored in all their research potentialities on the shelves of the Leiria District Archive”, and were investigated by Orlando Cardoso himself. In the same article, this one refers to a text from the newspaper “News of Macau” of January 17, 1950, about Lara Kings: “The Auster and Worsen Teacher; the tenacious and thorough tourist; the military who fought and consecrated the memory of those who fell in the field of struggle; the honest and firm friend; the lovely and humorous companion; social celibate that, despite this, did not disdain any opportunity to undo its gallants, always kind and inconsequential to any palm with a face that in the goto ”. Given the few studies that exist about Lara Reis and the estate he left, Celina Veiga de Oliveira left a suggestion: "May the CCCM get the detailed index of the Leiria Archive, so that the research is possible for any interested researchers."

item.title: Public Hiring | New regime “is on the good way,” says lawyer
item.description:
Marco Caldeira, a lawyer and auxiliary teacher at the University of Lisbon Faculty of Law, argues that the proposed public hiring law, under analysis in the specialty in Hemiciclo, is “on the good way” regarding the attempt to “promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization”. The theme was discussed last week at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center
The proposal of public hiring, currently under analysis in the specialty in the First Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL), was one of the topics addressed in the “Spring Conferences”, at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) last week. The author of the lecture, the lawyer and teacher Marco Caldeira, made praise for the diploma for his attempt to reform and innovation in many respects. "Although not perfect, the bill under discussion is justified by the need to update legislation that was approved four decades ago. It is a proposal that seems to point in the good way, with an effort to codify the regime, promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization," said the professor at the University of Lisbon Law School (FDUL) to HM. In addition, Marco Caldeira understands that the diploma, and the content proposed by the government, aims to "follow what are good practices adopted in Europe and the West in general." "It is also very commendable that the proposal was prepared following a serious and participated procedure of public consultation, which gave the opportunity to economic operators and contracting entities to identify deficiencies in current legislation and make suggestions," added Marco Caldeira. At the CCCM session, the FDUL professor also pointed out that the concern [demonstrated, in the diploma] with the competition and transparency of the procedures ”, as well as“ the focus on training in the use of databases, as well as the focus on centralization ”. The teacher also understood that, in this bill, the Portuguese regime "can help, because the practice followed in Portugal, and legislative evolutions, have useful teachings that, with proper adaptations, can be transposed to Macao." Positive points In the presentation at CCCM, Marco Caldeira highlighted several positive aspects of the current law proposal, namely “the express determination of inapplicability to certain contracts”, or the fact that “fundamental principles of public hiring” are established. It is also required with the new law “qualifications to candidates and competitors” of public tenders, and there is also “the clarification and standardization of the types of public hiring procedures”. Thus, a “centralized hiring regime” is created, as well as regulating “award criteria” in competitions, and the creation of an exclusive website for the public hiring area is also foreseen. Marco Caldeira also drew attention to the real need of this diploma, as public hiring was legislated with various diplomas, including two decrees of 1984 and 1985, which established, respectively, the expenditure regime with works and service acquisitions, and the process of acquisition of goods and services. Such diplomas were “undone of reality” of Macao, even though the 1984 decree was reviewed in 2021, the teacher considered. Marco Caldeira also considered that the process of revision of this diploma has been “slow”, as the public consultation took place between November 6, 2018 and January 4, 2019, and a later report was prepared, but the truth is that the proposal has been under analysis since December 2023, having been voted generally on January 11 last year. What has to change In the same session, the causal and university professor also highlighted the points already addressed by the first Standing Commission of AL regarding the necessary changes to legislate in the area of ​​public hiring. It was imposed “expressly consecrating fundamental legal principles, such as economy, efficiency and effectiveness, as well as publicity and transparency”, and there is also “a lack of regulation of public hiring policies”. There was also the “need to promote transparency in public hiring procedures” and ensure “greater protection of loyal competition”. There was also “lack of rigorous and explicit regulation on the composition and operation of the proposals evaluation committees” submitted to a public tender, and there is “lack of explicit demands on the qualifications and capabilities of candidates and competitors in hiring procedures”. Other gaps point to “insufficient regulation and transparency in the evaluation and adjudication procedures”, or “lack of explicit regulation on proposals presentation with an abnormally low price”. It was still necessary to “improve the sanctioning and inspection regime”, as well as bet on “regulation that promotes the development of electronic hiring”. Says the executive Looking at the justification of the law proposal, submitted by the Executive to AL, it is read that one of the great reasons for his presentation was even the legislative dispersion that was verified and the misfit over the current reality. "The nuclear part of these diplomas was prepared in the mid-1980s, and has been in force for over 30 years. A significant part of the provisions of other legal diplomas already has an obvious divergence regarding the needs of Macao's current socioeconomic development, the efficiency of public administration management and the reinforcement of transparency and supervision," he reads. According to the executive, "given that public hiring involves the use of the public purse, it is essential to review these regimes in order to meet the needs of the society of our day." Thus, in this law proposal, “the process and regime of expenses and acquisitions of goods and services” are regulated, with some provisions of a 1999 law, as “the provisions related to the public works contract regime have a high degree of specialization and are still effective”. It is intended, with the new law of public hiring, to “guarantee justice, impartiality in the evaluation of proposals”, and expressly defining criteria of aid and determining the rules of conduct of workers and members of the opening and evaluation of proposals submitted to competition, so that “excerpt their functions impartially and entirely”. Thus, it is foreseen that “contracting entities must adequately publicize the informative elements related to public hiring procedures”. They are “those related to the public tender, the clarifications provided, the rectification of documents, the extension of the deadline for the presentation of proposals, the causes for non -adjudication, the decision to annul the procedure and the award decision”. In order to guarantee loyal competition, the government wants to ensure that all entities interested in participating in a competition have “the broader access” to all procedures, prohibiting “all acts, agreements or practices that can prevent, false or restrict competition”. Moreover, there is the “principle of impartiality”, which determines that “the program of procedures, book of charges or other documents, made by the contracting party, cannot contain any clause designed to favor or harm a particular interested party”.

item.title: Aviation | Maria José de Freitas regrets removal of panels from the airport
item.description:
The first attempts to establish in Macao airlines in the early twentieth century were approached by historian Célia Reis in the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center. The architect Maria José de Freitas regretted the removal of panels from Macao International Airport that told this same story
Between the departure of the plane and the entrance to Macao International Airport (AIM) was a corridor that told the history of civil and military aviation from the territory of the early twentieth century. The project of this area of ​​the airport is by the studio of architect Maria José de Freitas, which regrets the removal of the panels and historical information that were installed in 2013. The architect left this idea in an intervention after the presentation of historian Célia Reis about the history of civil and military aviation in Macao on Monday, on the occasion of the “Spring Conferences” that take place at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in Lisbon. “We decided to tell the story of Aviation in Macao in this corridor, with a great extent, although at the time there was little documentation about it. I discovered some information in a work by Luís Andrade de Sá. We collected texts and images and put it all on the walls of this corridor, and that was there for a while.” "With a new direction [at AIM], I was asked how I could prove that all these events had happened. I had documentation in Portuguese, but I had nothing in Chinese and English, and at a time when I moved to Portugal on vacation, I saw, when I returned to Macau, who had removed all the information and images from this corridor. This story is unfortunate," he added. The architect added that she would like the history of the early days of Aviation in Macao to be told in these same walls. item.title: Housing | Song Pek Kei asks for subsidies to pay interest
item.description:
The deputy linked to the Fujian community wants the “healthy development” of the real estate market and asks the government to provide more land to build quality houses, and counteract the recent trend
Representative Song Pek Kei argues that the government must make a subsidy available to residents who ended up in the purchase of housing to help them pay interest on the contracted loans. The measure arises in a written interpellation of a deputy linked to the community of Fujian. In the logic of the legislator, it is necessary to finance the payment of loans from those who buy home because the real estate market has a “weak development”, while “consumer power has weakened even more”. "The real estate market in Macau is still relatively slow and the Malparado credit ratio has reached a record level, which affected the stable development of the financial market," he warns. The deputy considers that the reduction in housing prices in recent years should be a concern of society, because it is happening at a time when there is still demand, especially among the younger ones. Therefore, Song wants the government to subsidize the payment of interest on loans, when their amount does not exceed 4 percent. The interest bonus measurement in the purchase of housing in force in Macao in the past, especially in the 1990s and at the beginning of the establishment of the MSAR. In 2001, the measure covered dwellings that were bought for a value of less than 750 thousand patacas. Song Pek Kei considers that this measure was “very successive” and asks for repetition. In an interpeação in which the focus of the deputy is the youngest, the deputy close to Ung Choi Kun, former deputy for the Fujian community and one of the main local voices of real estate interests, also calls for changes in the exemption from the payment of the Seal Tax. Poor housing Song Pek Kei also acknowledges that the construction of latest housing at MSA has created a problem of lack of habitability conditions. According to the deputy, the latest buildings, built as studios or as apartments where there are no divisions demarcated by walls between the living room and the only room, offer decent conditions for residents. "Although there is a certain amount of residential apartments in Macao, there are structural problems in offering good apartments, which is due to the small dimension," he says. Song Pek Kei also recognizes that old housing is more quality than the recent and asks the executive to use the land reserve to allow more construction, this time with the quality that has not been guaranteed in recent years. “The Government of MSAR has a certain land reserve, will management accelerate its planning and adjust the relationship of the supply structure to provide better apartments that satisfy market demand and improve the quality of life of residents?” He asks.

item.title: Litiges | Deputies want more transparency
item.description: The 3rd Permanent Committee of the Legislative Assembly was discussing the future conciliation regime for family causes, which aims to create a mechanism to avoid the appellates in the event of divorce disputes, exercise of paternal power, food provision or issues related to the family home. After the working meeting, the committee chairman, Deputy Vong Hin Fai, indicated, based on the executive's explanations, that family conciliators will belong to private institutions and will be chosen by the Institute of Social Action (IAS). In the IAS current list, about 30 community service centers of local associations and 2,000 social workers can be chosen for conciliation. According to the statements cited by the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, during the working meeting, the committee deputies were concerned about the IAS criteria, as they argue that it is necessary to ensure independence, transparency and rationality not only of the conciliator but also the selection process. Therefore, they expect this aspect to be clarified. On the other hand, in relation to the litigious divorce, the law defines that the party that intends to request divorce has a period of three years to advance to the courts, after the facts that justify the request. Deputies consider that the count of this period must be suspended, while the conciliation period takes place.

item.title: Budget | Public revenues fall 14% until February
item.description:
The current revenue of the MSAR budget was 15.9 billion patacas in the first two months year, indicating a downward movement. The amount of tax charged on the game followed the trend and presented a 3.8 percent reduction
Macao Current Revenue fell 14 percent in the first two months of 2025, in annual terms, especially due to a drop in financial revenues and a deceleration in the game's recipes. Current revenue between January and February was 15.9 billion patacas, according to published "online" data by territory finance services on Thursday. The main reason for the decrease was the financial revenues, which went from billion in the first two months of 2024 to just two thousand patacas this year. This heading corresponds to the results of the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM), including investment and interest and dividends revenues. On the other hand, the data also reveal a drop of 3.8 percent to 14.2 billion patacas in tax revenues, which still represented 89.3 percent of the total. The six city game operators pay a 35 percent direct tax on the game's revenues, 2.4 percent for the Macao Social Security Fund and urban and tourist development and 1.6 percent delivered to the Macao Foundation for cultural, educational, scientific, academic and philanthropic purposes. Taxes on the game fell despite the Macao casinos registered total revenues of almost 38 billion patacas in the first two months of the year, more 0.5 percent than in the same period as 2024. Above estimates In January and February, Macau collected 14.2 percent of the current revenue projected for 2025 in the region's budget, which is 112.6 billion patacas. In early December, the Macao Study Center and the University of Macao Economics Department foresaw that revenues should be smaller than the government's estimated: 111.8 billion patacas. With falling revenues, Macao ended February with a surplus in public accounts of six billion patacas, 24.8 percent less than in the same period of 2024. Macau closed last year with a surplus of 15.8 billion patacas, more than double the recorded in 2023. In addition, it was the first year since 2020, at the beginning of the pandemic, that the territory was able to keep accounts on positive land, something required by the basic law, without transfers from the financial reserve. The surplus shrunk despite the public expense descended 6.1 percent in January and February, to 9.99 billion patacas, mainly due to the lower investment in infrastructure. The government spent 2.48 billion patacas under the Administration Investment and Expenses Plan (PIDDA), minus 24.9 percent compared to the first two months of 2024. On the contrary, the current expense increased 3.1 percent to 7.51 billion patacas, mainly due to a 5.7 percent increase in social support and subsidies given to the population.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence in Macao Culinary
item.description: (Continuation of the March 20 edition) As the food industry adapts to new technologies, bosses take on new roles as curators of experiences rather than mere producers. The combination of human creativity with AI capabilities can lead to unparalleled gastronomic offers. The impact of AI on consumer behavior cannot be ignored. The emergence of mobile applications that use AI algorithms to predict gastronomic preferences can change the way residents and tourists experience food in Macao. Food delivery services, such as FoodPanda and Uber Eats that do not yet operate in Macao, use AI to suggest restaurants based on users' habits and preferences. This personalization increases customer satisfaction by presenting options that closely align with individual tastes. In addition, food sustainability is another critical area to which AI can contribute positively. In Macao, like in other regions, there is increasing sensitization for the environmental impact of food production and waste. AI can optimize supply chain logistics, predict demand and reduce excesses, leading to more sustainable practices. For example, algorithms can analyze seasonal trends to suggest menus that align with available ingredients, reducing waste and ensuring that customers receive fresh offers. Collaboration between food brands and AI development companies is also becoming predominant. Partnerships may arise with the aim of creating innovative culinary products that capitalize on AI data and knowledge. For example, collaborations between chefs and technology companies can result in products designed specifically for Macanese cuisine, combining traditional recipes with AI -generated recommendations for the purchase and use of ingredients. The future of AI in the gastronomic landscape of Macau is promising. With continuous advances in automatic learning and data analysis, we can expect even greater AI integration into kitchens. For example, kitchen robots that may replicate the accuracy of human heads may become common. These robots will be able to improve techniques such as cooking and precise emphasis, improving the consistency of food production. In addition, virtual reality and AI can join to revolutionize gastronomic experiences in Macao. Imagine that customers can participate in virtual cooking classes guided by top chiefs, learning how to prepare traditional dishes while exploring the integration of Ia in real time. These experiences would promote culinary education, maintaining the essence of heritage. In the light of such advances, the ethical considerations surrounding AI in the culinary arts should also be carefully analyzed. The question of the displacement of jobs due to automation is a pressing concern. As AI assumes tasks traditionally performed by humans, bosses and kitchen staff can see their functions evolve. The formation and improvement of competences will become fundamental to ensure that cooking professionals can prosper in an IMI environments. Educational institutions in Macao must respond to this need, incorporating culinary technology courses in their curricula. This initiative will prepare aspiring bosses not only to dominate traditional cooking techniques, but also to understand the role of AI in modern kitchen. By combining the traditional teaching of culinary arts with technology, the next generation of bosses can enjoy the best of both worlds. The use of AI in Macau cuisine means an important turning point in the way food is prepared, served and experienced. By improving operational efficiency and customizing gastronomic experiences, AI brings a new era of culinary possibilities. Influential heads like André Chiang are leading the process, demonstrating how technology can coexist with tradition. However, the authenticity of Macanese cuisine should be preserved as we adopt these innovations. By addressing this weighted integration, Macau can remain a vibrant gastronomic center, balancing the richness of his heritage with the exciting possibilities of the digital age. The interaction between AI and traditional macao cuisine is a reflection of broader trends in the cooking arts globally. The trip of mixing the AI ​​with Macau's cultural heritage is just starting, but has a vast potential to shape the future of food. Resistance to embrace it can mean stagnation, while opening to innovation can lead to a prosperous and dynamic culinary scenario in the future.

item.title: LIMITS OF WORK
item.description: On March 17, the Hong Kong Census and Statistics Department released data showing that approximately 12,900 people worked on digital food delivery platforms and other goods over the past year. 52.5 percent of these workers are between 15 and 39 years old, more than half are less than 40 and 24.2 percent over 50 years. 64.7 percent of respondents stated that this work is their main source of income, 61 percent receives less than $ 5,000 from Hong Kong (HKD) per month and 37.1 percent earns more than 15,000 hkd a month. 53.9 percent work less than 44 hours a week, 24.9 percent over 44 hours per week and 21.2 percent of these workers claim not to have a fixed time. 68.6 percent work only for a delivery platform every day. 91.3 percent of respondents say they have started working in this business because it is easy to enter, having a flexible working method and having great control over methods and procedures. 98.2 percent claim to have more maneuver field to balance work with personal life. 45 percent are attracted to this work due to salary. Other data previously issued by the Hong Kong government show that the average salary of these workers was 22,000 USD between October and December 2024. By comparison, only 37.1 percent earn more than 15,000 USD, showing that they usually receive wages below average. Office employees in Hong Kong usually work from 9am to 6pm during the week and another four hours on Saturdays, which means a total of 49 hours of weekly work. Excluding the break from an hour for lunch from Monday to Friday, exactly 44 hours. Since 53.9 percent of distributors work less than 44 hours per week, it is reasonable that their salaries will be lower than the market average. 98.2 percent of people who make deliveries say they do this service by giving them more room to balance their work with family life. This demonstrates that the new generation pay more attention to the balance between work and personal life, a different phenomenon from the “tele-work” that emerged during the epidemic. The “tele-work” means working from home because it is difficult to evaluate the limit between work and family life. As people working on delivery platforms can control their working hours, the problem of defining the border between work and leisure is very small. The three main limits that define the exercise of labor functions are psychological, temporal and physical. Psychological boundaries are rules created by individuals who determine specific thoughts, behaviors and emotions, which means that one should have a rational attitude when working and an emotional attitude when one is in family. Time limits mean defining working hours, turning off duties outside this time, and dedicating this extra labor time to home and family. The physical limit is defined by the workplace. When you go to the office you will work, when you leave the work ended. The statistical data of delivery platforms show that people choose to collaborate with them mainly because they have more room to control their hours and work model. This phenomenon indicates that the new generation values ​​the existence of boundaries to work time and, in terms of psychological limits, seeks to have more control over their work. In the post-epicide era, it is given greater importance to the balance between professional and family career. Limits theory helps companies understand and better manage work and family boundaries, thus achieving better balance and allowing workers' quality of life to improve. In Hong Kong, delivery platform distributors earn less. Although it has a better notion of the limits of work and a happier family life, material goods that can give to the family are limited. These workers need to achieve balance between family life and material goods. From a business point of view, giving workers more space and flexibility, as well as broader borders, will help recruit a new generation of employees. Suddenly, you have to share the space of a boat with other animals of completely different species, and ensure they live. “Flow - to Deriva” is a lesson of humanity and, perhaps, a reflection on climate change, depending on their eyes. It can now be seen at Cinemateca Paixão, starting this Friday, having three other sessions scheduled. Gints Zilbalodis's “Flow - Flow” is a production of Latvia that surprised the half world and the Hollywood Academy, having won the Oscar for best animated film. The film's initial budget was US $ 3.6 million and its success surprised even the author of the film. "We thought that at best we would be selected for some festivals and would have a good season of festivals," Zilbalodis, 30, told France-Presse (AFP). For Latvia, the two Oscar nominations were historical, as no movie in the Baltic country of only 1.8 million inhabitants had played an Oscar. But "April charms" continues with other stories, already outside the world of animation. One of them is “dog on trial”, which can be seen from this Thursday. It is an out-of-vulgar story in which an Avril lawyer defends a dog in the court bar. The film eventually reveals comic and at the same time dramatic episodes around issues such as the judicial system, the rights of women and the animals themselves. Adventures in Paris Following is “Grand Maison Paris”, a Japanese movie spent in the French capital. The first session takes place today at 7:30 pm, followed by two more display dates. The story revolves around the opening of a Paris restaurant called "Grand Maison Paris", after the success obtained with the three -star Michelin winner "Grand Maison Tokyo." Natsuki Obana and Rinko Hayami then ventured in Paris, wanting to be the first Asian bosses to get Michelin stars in the light city, but the challenges they face make adventure a much harder task than they thought. The protagonists must also deal with the pressure of a city full of well -known chiefs of French cuisine. Another film, of the genre documentary, which can be seen from tomorrow is "Four Trails", although all the screening sessions are already sold out. This is a real story, that of Andre Blumberg, who left alone to run the four long distance iconic tracks from Hong Kong in just 72 hours. It's 298 kilometers, and over 14,500 meters unevenly later, one of the most difficult marathons in the world, with the name "Hong Kong Four Trails Ultra Challenge" was created. The documentary thus portrays the 2021 edition of this competition. Inside the Asian films list is “Montages of A Modern Motherhood,” a Hong Kong movie this year, which will be screened on April 15 and 27. It is the story of Suk-Jing, which welcomes a baby daughter in your life, and that will never be the same. Speak Suk-Jing realizes that the day is too small for everything she has to do, complaining that her husband does not help her in this new maternity task. Family family dramas and reflections on the need for better days begin. Within another section, “Ater Style-Double functionality”, the British director Mike Leigh's film on family ethics is also presented this Friday. The story revolves around the nervous pansy, with contrasting psychological behavior in the face of his sister, younger and more relaxed. In this movie, one can explore family relationships and the difficulties that exist to sometimes maintain harmony in these connections.

item.title: South Korean artist Shin Min wins first edition of “MGM Discoveries”
item.description: Shin Min, South Korean artist, was the winner of the first edition of the MGM Discoveries Art Award, awarded together by MGM and Art Basel de Hong Kong. According to a MGM statement, the artist, represented by Seoul's P21 gallery, won with an “innovative installation”, named “Ew! There is Hair in the Food !!!”, in which he used “a powerful symbolism and personal experiences to confront social norms and systemic injustices”. According to the same note, Shin Min "expects this work to serve as a powerful tool to sensitize society and ultimately improve the working conditions of the population." The prize includes a monetary value of $ 50,000 and the "opportunity to be invited by MGM to hold an exhibition and participate in artistic exchanges in Macao." The objective of the “MGM Discoveries” award is “to promote artistic diversity and connect Hong Kong, Macau and the world through iconic cultural events”, and this initiative “recognizes the originality and innovation of emerging international artists”, as well as “expanding their visibility in the global art world”. Shared views Kenneth Feng, president and executive director of MGM China Holdings Limited, said “MGM and Art Basel Hong Kong share the common vision of promoting global artistic and cultural development”, and this joint award “is a commitment to discovering emerging artists and celebrating its originality and creativity, offering a platform to develop its potential and grow”. "In addition, through international cultural efforts, Macau is closely united with Hong Kong and the global stage, expanding the global network and the exchange of Macao," said the official. Angelle Siyang-Le, director of Art Basel Hong Kong, said that the jury chose "Shin Min from a remarkable set of artists presented in the" Sector Discoveries ", which highlights emerging artists and galleries through individual presentations of recent projects." MGM also organized a guided tour of Art Basel de Hong Kong, one of the most important art fairs in the world, for about 50 Macao's cultural and educational representatives. With this award, the game operator says she wants to “bring new artistic perspectives to Macau and the Great Bay”, as well as “a variety of international artistic and cultural activities”.

item.title: IPOR | Literary Festival “Letras & Companhia” starts this week
item.description:
This Friday begins another edition of the Children's Festival “Letters & Companhia”, organized by the Portuguese Institute of Oriente (IPOR), which brings a very current theme: the use of artificial intelligence in education. Highlight for the presence of Portuguese singer and writer Luísa Sobral and the presentation of the book illustrated “The Adventurous Journey of the Fatherland”, by Filipa Brito Pais
Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Education. This complex relationship, but increasingly present in our daily lives, is the central theme of this year's edition of the Literary and Cultural Festival for parents and children “Letras & Company”, organized by the Portuguese Institute of the East (IPOR) in partnership with the Portuguese Consulate General in Macau and Hong Kong. The event, which starts this Friday, April 4, and ends on May 6, also has a series of institutional support. This year's theme is thus "artificial intelligence in education - the robot and me." One of the highlights of the poster is the presence of author and songwriter Luísa Sobral who launches the bilingual edition (Portuguese and Chinese) of her latest book, “The Weight of Words”. According to a statement from IPOR, Luísa Sobral will “promote a set of workshops in local schools, as well as a concert open to the public” that takes place this Saturday, April 6. Another highlight of the poster is the presentation of Joana Morgado Bento's book “The Seed of Love”, a work written in verse that has as its theme positive parenting. "The author's starting point for the writing of this book was the recognition of the inevitable imperfection of parents, of which a recognized difficulty is born: how to educate a child so that the child today is a happy adult tomorrow? Joana Morgado Bento will answer this and other questions, in a session directed to parents and children," writes Ipor. In a collaboration with the Somos Association! - Portuguese Language Communication Association, will also be presented the book “Once upon a time… my language”, which resulted from a literary contest promoted by the entity. It is a work that brings together written tales of purpose for this contest, and all texts are translated and adapted to Chinese. The release of the book will be held through a shadow theater. Remember the Fatherland After a launch in Portugal, Filipa Brito Pais prepares to launch, at this festival, the book aimed at the youngest in Chinese language, “The Adventurous Trip of the Fatherland-from Portugal to Macao on plane (1924)”, which marks the 100th anniversary of the first Portuguese air trip-Macau. The author, a niece of aviator António Brito Pais, will make known to the younger ones the extraordinary feat of the three aviator and dreamers, António Brito Pais, José Manuel Sarmento de Beires and Manuel Gouveia, who at the time managed, with little financial support, to do what no one had been able to do until then. The “Letras & Company” also provides two workshops developed and boosted by Catarina Mesquita, founder of children's book publisher “Mandarina Books”, directed to children and young people. The two workshops, entitled “Usually…” and “Real or Artificial?”, Will aim to stimulate the creativity of the younger ones, either through a creative mechanism that involves the valorization of everyday and banal, either through an attitude that finds in doubt and sensory distrust a way to promote imagination. Meditation and Training Yoga instructor Ana Júlia Sampaio will be responsible for conducting two meditation sessions. “Happy Kids” will be an activity divided into two workshops, properly thought and adapted taking into account the age of the participants. These two sessions will help develop children's body, mental and emotional awareness. The poster also features Macau Adelina Moura, a trainer of training courses and continuous training of teachers in the field of technologies in the classroom, as a member of the “Gilt-Games, Interaction and Learning Technologies” research group from Porto Engineering Institute. At the festival, Adelina Moura will give teachers a training and teach the workshop “Digital Literacy - Promotion of Positive Interactions online”, where participants will be invited to reflect on topics such as application of strategies to protect digital identity and personal data online, the creation and responsible information sharing, the application of methods that can encourage online research and critical analysis of digital sources. The festival also features a conference open to the general public, entitled “A AI in Education”, which takes place on April 16 with Adelina Moura, psychologist Nuno Gomes and researcher Min Yang of United Nations University Institute in Macau. The theater is also present in “Letras & Companhia” with two pieces, one of which is in charge of the company “Disrupt” that presents the show “Peripeças - The History of Portugal with Artificial Intelligence”, a comic piece about the power that narratives and stories take on this predominantly digital age. The second theatrical representation, “The Peakture”, will be a nonverbal show developed by the local company “Stone Commune”, in which the body movements of the actors, puppets and some live video projections will be at the service of a moving story about the unthinkable obstacles that a simple trip can raise. Also noteworthy is the initiatives “One Night in… Library”, which aims to stimulate the taste for reading through dramatized tales reading sessions, and the exhibition “The Robot and Me”, inaugurated on Friday. This show will present the works developed by artists from the region and students from local schools, with the special participation of artist José Nyögeri, who will expose a set of works of his own on the subject. The festival was created in 2021 and revolves around the concept of the “three l's”: language, book and reading. For this edition, we seek to “address the introduction of technologies not only in teaching, but also in the lives of children”.

item.title: Tui reduces resident sentence for fatal crime in Zhuhai
item.description: The last court (TUI) decided to reduce the penalty of a 44 -year -old resident in August 2023 for killing another resident in Zhuhai. It all happened on a night of night fun that ended the worst way, in the Gongbei area, and the two men began to argue on the street when the murderer decided to attack the other resident with two scissors blows. The Base Judicial Court (TJB) sentenced the resident to an effective 15 -year prison for the practice, in material authorship and in a consummate form, of a crime of homicide. In addition, the resident was ordered to pay compensation of more than two million patacas to the widow, with interest. It was then that the murderer decided to appeal to the court of second instance, because he did not agree with the sentence, and Tui has now reduced this sentence to 13 years and nine months. Unintentionally “direct” According to the TUI judgment, the murderer requested the reduction of the sentence claiming that it was under the influence of alcohol and did not know that scissors could effectively kill the other resident. In addition, the applicant claimed that the police had been called before assaulting the man with the scissors. However, Tui understands that "such circumstances are not valid and effective to exclude their guilt as to conduct and its responsibility." Tui understands that a situation of "eventual deceit" is at stake and not a "direct" intention of killing the other, so it was possible to be possible "a moderate reduction in the penalty". The details of the case are described in the ruling: the two men were, around 12:02 am on July 31, 2023 eating with the deceased's wife and seven friends, and the murderer drank “three to four beer bottles”, some of them gone to play Mahjong to follow. The discussion between the two men took place around 3:50 am "for trivial reasons", becoming "increasingly serious." Friends tried to separate them unsuccessfully. Around four in the morning, the murderer “abandoned Mahjong's establishment, running, took a scissors from a fruit store with which he gave several blows to the left side of his left -handed chest, arm and forearm and thumb of the left hand” of the deceased. The death was declared at 4:15 am by the Zhuhai Public Security Police. The perpetrator was arrested at the entrance of Macau.

item.title: Portsmouth will investigate maritime energy transition in Macau
item.description: Macao was one of the places selected by the University of Portsmouth to study the inheritance of the energy transition in the coastal communities of the global southern and how they cross the age of decarbonization, the project officer told Lusa. After the Port of Callao, in the center of Peru, Macau was the choice of the University of Portsmouth in the United Kingdom to investigate as maritime communities from the so -called global south crossed one of the milestones of the Industrial Revolution, the transition from sail to steam. Relief commercial warehouse, Macao has a very rich story linked to the sea, a factor that weighed on the center's decision and maritime cultures (PCMC, British acronym) at the British University. "It is probably one of the first European enclaves in East Asia and has a long history of international travel by the sea from 1500," Melanie Bassett researcher Lusa told Lusa. The creation of a doctoral research scholarship will bring to the territory an academic, whose mission is still to understand how these communities can adapt to a sustainable future. "We then want to look at the new energy transitions, to decarbonization, how Macau is making this transition and if people are aware of the changes," added Bassett, who leads the project "From Steam to Green to Green: Empower port communities in the global south [Sail to Steam, Carbon to Green: Empowering Port Communitiesin The Global South]" Portsmouth. The project, which extends for a period of six and a half years, started in February, with the investigation to focus on the Peruvian Port of Callao, but should later expand to two other regions “somewhere in the Indian subcontinent and West Africa”. Understand the past Only the investigation will bring tangible results, but Bassett points out that, with the primacy of the steam vessel, the travel of communities and industries were generally away from the sea waterfront. Changes have also occurred in several businesses linked to the sector, from the fishing industry to naval construction. “We anticipate seeing this kind of changes, but also with the advent of European colonization, we see changes in cultures and architecture and how it affects the population, and then how, over time, these cultures merge and hybridize to create new cultures and new understandings of the world,” he said. “It's part of Lloyds Register Foundation's financing to learn from the past,” Bassett added, referring to the project's funder who, in the case of Macao, will have the collaboration of the University of Macao and the local Maritime Museum. It is also expected to have the communities active in research. Therefore, the recruitment of the academic that will lead the investigation requires language skills to ensure communication with the population. Recruitment for this research that is divided between Portsmouth and Macau is expected to be completed in April, and the project starts in October.

item.title: Takeaway | Up to 50% tariffs threaten restoration
item.description:
Home food delivery applications touched the restoration sector to the wall, imposing high delivery rates and changing customer habits. The Macao Catering Industry Association says APPs threaten business survival and calls for government intervention
When the COVID-19 pandemic forced social isolation and distancing, the mere act of taking a meal away from home became a nightmare. From this time, it became common to see the Macao roads full of MFood and Aomi scooters, and later to Tikbee. Finding the restrictions on combating pandemic, remained the habit of asking for meals, drinks and desserts through these platforms, and complaints from the restoration sector began to emerge. The president of the Macao Catering Industry Association, Aeson Law, has been one of the critical voices of how applications have changed the industry and forced restaurants to pay high delivery fees or abdicate a popular way to do business. "When there were no Takeaway platforms, if we faced 100 patacas, this value entered the box. Nowadays we even delivered 50 of these 100 patacas to applications, as well as the operating costs of a restaurant. It is difficult to survive in this scenario," said the representative, quoted by the citizen newspaper. The associative leader recalls that meal delivery platforms began by charging more than 20 percent of the amount charged to the customer as a distribution tariff, which considered reasonable. However, "apps also started charging distribution or delivery tariff to customers," he said, raising prices. As such, they ended up “asking traders to pay the slice that should be paid by the consumer,” he said. Do something Aeson Law does not realize why applications have been charging twice distribution rates. The fact is that restaurants are required to pay twice if they want to occupy a summit place in the ranking of applications. With the double collection, the applications are about 40 percent of the online sales of restaurants, a slice that grows to 50 percent during discount campaigns. Aeason Law considers that the only way to control excessive charges is through government intervention, as restaurants do not have negotiating power to cope with the prevalence of online platforms. Thus, the representative of the sector expects the executive to elaborate a law that will introduce a mechanism for supervising the online platform action and complaint presentation.

item.title: Islands Hospital | Extended aesthetic and vaccine services
item.description:
The director of health services, Alvis Lo, states that throughout this year will be expanded the aesthetic services and external vaccination consultations of the islands hospital. The future also undergoes cooperation with dealers to bet on more health tourism services
The availability of aesthetic and vaccine services abroad at Hospital das Ilhas will be extended throughout this year. The confirmation of the new services came from Alvis Lo, director of health services, and is the response to a written interpellation of Deputy Lei Chan U. The availability of these services is part of the government's strategy to bet on health tourism, presented as Big Health. As part of this strategy, Alvis Lo explains that the Islands Hospital will “take full advantage of the notoriety of the Peking Union Medical College Hospital brand”, which explores the services available, not only at the level of services provided, but also to collaborate in terms of research and health partnerships. Regarding the services provided, Alvis Lo points out that aesthetics and external vaccines services are currently available. Regarding the area of ​​aesthetics, the doctor points out that "the initial focus lies in facial rejuvenation" is being performed with "resort to the most advanced medical equipment of Hong Kong and Macau". In this service, it is also indicated that “16 therapeutic projects” are being implemented, including using “Picosecond laser” technologies and “radio -ferotement microagulating”. Regarding vaccination, it is indicated that the islands hospital offers five types of vaccines abroad among which the Nanavalent Vaccine against Human Papillomavirus (HPV), the zoster herpes vaccine and the pneumococcal vaccine. Expansion of services Throughout this year, Alvis Lo also points out that the Islands Hospital will “further expand the supply of aesthetic and vaccination medicine projects” and create “new specific external consultation services”, such as “weight loss consultations and cancer prevention”. In the future, Alvis Lo indicates that the path will progressively implement “private ward services” and “Individual Health Management Projects” to achieve “constant progress in medical tourism and Big Health industry”. On the other hand, the doctor indicates that the islands hospital is “attracting more and more tourists to visit Macau” to receive “medical care and health care”. In addition, in response to Chan U law it is indicated that tourism services will launch other “medical tourism services, actively promoting cooperation between the Macao tourist sector and the various integrated tourism and leisure companies for the development of tourist products focused on medical care, well-being and therapeutic food”. Alvis Lo points out will also be “launched several accommodation promotions and the promotion [of medical services] will be intensified with the target markets”.

item.title: Earthquake | Macao with alert to Thailand and CE expresses condolences
item.description:
The executive issued a travel alert signal to Thailand following the magnitude 7.7 earthquake on the Richter scale and received a request for assistance and seven information. Sam Hou Fai sent a message of condolences to the population of Myanmar, where the dead of the dead yesterday exceeded 1,600
On Saturday night, Sam Hou Fai addressed “a message of condolences to Myanmar's leader, Min Aung Hlaing, following the earthquake that shook the region,“ expressing its senses condolences, condolences and attention and solidarity with the victims' wounded and relatives ”. At 2:50 pm, Macao's time, a lattice of magnitude 7.7 on the Richter scale, and with epicenter near the Myanmar capital, shook the Earth, and 11 minutes later a 6.7 replica was followed by Richter scale. The earthquake felt in Thailand and several Chinese provinces, with greater intensity in Yunnan, but also in Gizhou, Guangxi and Sichuan, in Laos, Vietname, Bangladesh and India. However, Myanmar was the most affected country, with fatal counting yesterday to 1,644 dead. In the note published Saturday night, the chief executive demonstrated the grief and stressed the strong bonds of friendship between the peoples of Macau and Myanmar. "It was with great dismay that I received the information of the occurrence of strong intensity earthquake in Myanmar. (…) In the name of the government of Masters and the population, we address our most senses condolences, condolences and solidarity, to the entire population of Myanmar, with special attention to the families of the deceased, the injured and residents in the most affected areas." Sam Hou Fai also stated that "Macao residents have empathy and are solidary," and "available to provide, within our abilities, all the necessary support for rescue and later reconstruction work." Full attention The Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) reacted just over an hour to the first shake, noting that people who are traveling should “pay attention to their personal security, be vigilant and carefully follow the evolution of the situation”. Still on Friday night, the MSar issued to Thailand the travel alert level 1, the lowest of a total of three levels, which was already in force for Myanmar, but due to the civil war in the country. According to STD, this level "represents the emergence of a threat to personal security." STD also revealed that it had received a request for help from a resident of Macao who lost a flight due to the closure of roads that prevented him from reaching the airport, and seven requests for information. Although there are no organized excursions from Macau either in Thailand or Myanmar, STD has sent messages to 1,475 mobile phones registered in the territory that were accessing roaming services in both countries or neighboring Laos. No excursions After Friday's earthquake, which had an epicenter at Myanmar, the president of the Macao Tourist Industry Association, Andy Wu, confirmed that there was no Macao excursion at Myanmar, Thailand nor in the Chinese province of Yunnan at the time of shaking. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, the official revealed that the direction of tourism services immediately contacted the travel agencies of the territory to find out if they took excursions in the affected regions. However, Andy Wu stressed the inevitability of residents in the affected areas and revealed that, despite the significant volume of the information request, there was no dropouts to the areas affected by the earthquake, which will be made during Easter holidays and Cheng Ming. Replica of 5.1 A 5.1 magnitude earthquake on Richter scale yesterday shook Mandalay in downtown Myanmar (former Birmania), being a replica of the 7.7 magnitude earthquake that caused more than 1,600 dead and 3,400 wounded. The United States Geological Service (USGS) stated that yesterday's tremor had its epicenter 28 kilometers northwest of Mandalay and a hypotrocemine at a depth of 10 kilometers. Until the closing of this edition, there was no record of victims or material damage to this latest earthquake. Lame

item.title: Portugal leads European delegation to the International Tourism Fair
item.description: Professionals from the tourist sector and Portuguese journalists will lead a European delegation to the Macao International Tourism Fair, from 25 to 27 April, Lusa told the region's authorities. The Directorate of Macao Tourism Services (STD) has revealed that a European delegation will participate in the 13th International Tourism Expo (Industry) of Macau (Mite). In a written response, STD added that the delegation is being organized by the Portuguese Association of Travel and Tourism Agencies (APAVT). Macao will host in June the semi -sectional meeting of the European Confederation of Travel Agency Associations and Tour Operators (ECTAA). “I think it's a good start,” said STD director Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes on January 17. "Although it will have less than 100 people, they represent 80,000 travel agencies from all over Europe in all," said the leader. "This is also a result of good collaboration between us and APAVT, because it was through APAVT that we were introduced to Ectaa," said Senna Fernandes. Lusitanian aid Senna Fernandes added that Portugal can help the region attract more visitors from the rest of Europe. “Portugal is not just about reaching Portugal. Portugal also serves to help us reach the European market,” said Senna Fernandes. In April 2024, Ectaa Vice President Heli Mäki-Fränti told Lusa during the 12th Mite that the meeting in the territory happens “at initiative” of APAVT. It will be the second time that Ectaa has gathered outside Europe after Kuala Lumpur in Malaysia. The Confederation also chose Macau as a favorite destination for 2025. The territory wants to attract more international visitors and this year alone, participated in the Madrid International Tourism Fair in January and at ITB Berlin, the largest travel fair in the world, between March 4, as well as seminars in the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia. Macau was not present at the Lisbon Tourism Stock Exchange (BTL), which took place between March 12 and 16, but STD assured that Portugal remains “a priority market”. STD recalled that Macau will host, between December 2 and 4, the 50th APAVT Congress, “considered the largest annual meeting of the Portuguese tourist industry and which is expected to gather between 700 and 800 participants”.

item.title: Macau Legend | Confirmed losses of 667.2 million
item.description:
Given the announced loss and the accumulated debts of $ 2.51 billion from Hong Kong, Macau Legend Development admits that its future is concerned
Macao Legend Development (MLD) announced on Friday that the damage of the game operator fired in 2024, in part due to the decision of the Government of Cape Verde to recover an unfinished hotel in the capital. The results confirm the losses that had been anticipated early last week. According to a report sent to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, MLD lost $ 667.2 million from Hong Kong last year. By 2023, the company had registered a loss of less than three million dollars from Hong Kong. MLD estimated a loss of Hong Kong's $ 45.9 million after the Cape Verdean government on November 18, formalizing the reversal of the company's Hotel and other unfinished works of the company, at Santa Maria Island and Gamboa's waterfront, in Praia. The operator reiterated on Friday that she is "taking the necessary measures to safeguard the interests of the group (..), including exploring all available options to contest the decision." On the other hand, MLD admitted to “significant doubts about the group's ability to continue in activity” due to total debt of $ 2.51 billion from Hong Kong. Bad investments In 2015, the then MLD leader, David Chow Kam Fai, signed an agreement for an investment of 250 million euros. After revisions, five and a half years ago, the conclusion of the first phase was scheduled for 2021. In recent years, there are only guards at the venues of the venue, an area of ​​about 160,000 square meters, which includes the partially sulved Santa Maria islet and, a paved bridge of a few meters that connects it to a building of about eight floors, empty and sealed with Taipal. The government said it gave Macao Legend "all opportunities for the resuming of works or to negotiate the sale of actions or the assignment of its contractual position to a potential interested in the continuation of the project," but no alternatives were presented. “Given that the MLD has violated, flagrant and repeatedly, the obligations (…) there is no other way out of the State of Cape Verde, other than to resolve” the contracts, reads a decision of the Council of Ministers. According to the executive, the company "also violated" the legal regime of exploitation of games, "by transferring, without authorization from the Government of Cape Verde, the ownership of more than 20 percent of the capital capital." In late 2023, in an interview with Hong Kong TVB television, Macau Legend's president and executive director, Li Chu Kwan, said the group intended to end the projects in Cape Verde and Cambodia by 2025.

item.title: South Sea | Beijing discovers large oil deposit
item.description: Chinese oil company Cnooc discovered an important oil field in the east of the Southern Sea of ​​China, with proven reserves of over 100 million tons, the state press said yesterday. According to Chinese official news agency Xinhua, the identified field, Huizhou 19-6, is about 170 kilometers from the city of Shenzhen in the south of the country. Test drilling produced 413 barrels of raw and 68,000 cubic meters of natural gas per day, according to the same source. Proven reservations of the oil field, ie the amount of hydrocarbons whose recovery can be almost certainly estimated using current techniques, ascend to more than 100 million tons, according to the information cited by Xinhua. Southern China's underground is largely sub-pitched due to territorial disputes, but most known oil and gas deposits are in non-contested areas, according to the US energy information administration. Beijing claims the sovereignty of almost the whole sea, over which the Philippines, Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia and Brunei also have claims.

item.title: XI Jinping stimulates investment in meeting with foreign entrepreneurs
item.description: On the morning of Friday, March 28, XI Jinping met with “representatives of the international business community” at the Great People's Hall in Beijing. “The reason I have invited all present is to hear your ideas, respond to your concerns and support the development of foreign companies in China,” explained the president in the initial words of his intervention, paying tribute to the numerous benefits that foreign companies brought to the country. "China's impressive achievements are not only due to the Communist Party and the Chinese people, but also to the support and help of the international community, including the contribution of foreign companies operating in China," said XI. "Foreign companies represent a third of China's total imports and exports, a quarter of their industrial value added and a seventh of their tax revenues, creating more than 30 million jobs," he explained. Therefore, “here I would like to express my sincere gratitude to all the foreign companies that participated and supported the development of China!” He concluded. Many will say that the Chinese president is, in the background, to respond to the growing pessimism of multinational companies in relation to the Chinese market, evidenced by the fall in foreign direct investment. item.title: Ukraine | Lula da Silva will talk to Putin and Zelensky
item.description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva said Saturday that he will have separated conversations with leaders from Russia and Ukraine, Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelensky, respectively, about the need to negotiate an eventual end of the war. During a press conference in Hanoi at the end of an official three-day visit to Vietnam, the South American leader said that bringing peace back to Ukraine, invaded by Russia since February 2021, would be "the best thing" to both countries, but also for Europe and the rest of the world. “In a conflict, both sides have to be willing to negotiate,” said Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, who intends to visit Putin in Moscow on May 9 on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II. "Peace destroys and peace builds ... I will discuss this with Putin again," he added. The President of the Republic also said that he will talk to Zelensky by telephone, "this week" without specifying the day. Brazil has repeatedly condemned the Russian invasion, but has raised skepticism of much of the West and Ukraine itself for the peace proposal in 2024, in partnership with China. This week, the United States issued two separate statements about their contacts with Russia and Ukraine in Riade, a Saudi capital, under the negotiations for a possible end of the conflict. The parties, which continue to attack each other, have agreed to ensure safe navigation, eliminate the use of force and prevent the use of commercial ships for military purposes in the Black Sea, as well as developing measures to ban attacks on energy facilities in both countries. Despite the huge costs of the Russian invasion, most Ukrainians are in favor of resistance and not surrender in case of full withdrawal of Washington's support, since Europe remains by its side, according to a poll from the Kiev International Institute of Sociology (Kiis).

item.title: Commerce | Beijing, Tokyo and Seoul respond to Trump with acceleration of agreements

The ministers of industry and commerce of the three countries yesterday held an emergency meeting in Seoul, designed to settle policies to respond to the acceleration of tariff increases imposed by Washington - a tripartite emergency meeting and the first in this format since 2020.
